dict.string: Enter a value to calculate VAT
Clear all caches of this workflow

**Calculate Anything** is a workflow for Alfred, that uses natural language and is able to calculate multiple things like currency, cryptocurrency, time, distance, data storage, units, vat, px, em, rem, percentage, color and more.
![Calculate Anything](./assets/calculate-anything.jpg)
## Why There are several conversion workflows out there but I wanted a workflow that worked naturally. For example, you can open Alfred, type 100 + 9 and get a result. No need for keywords or hotkeys -- it just works. With Calculate Anything you can do the same, simply type 100 + 16%, 100 euros to usd, 100km in cm or 100 years to hours and many more.
## Features
- **Natural language** - type `100 euros to dollars`, `100 euros in usd`, `100€ to $`, `100eur usd`, `100 euros a dolares` -- it does not matter, the same result will be displayed - **Currency** - Up to 168 currencies - **Cryptocurrency** - Support for up to 5,000 cryptocurrencies - **Units** - `100 kilometers to meters` or `100 km to m` or simply `100km m` - **Data Storage** - `100 gigabytes in megabytes`, `2 gb to mb`, `400MiB to kib`, `2tb gb` etc. - **Percentages** - `100 + 16%`, `100 - 16%`, `40 as a % of 50`, `20 is what % of 50` etc. - **px,em,rem,pt** - `12px` or `12px to em` or `12px pt` - **Time** - `time +15 years`, `time now plus 6 hours` or convert a timestamp - **VAT** - value added tax calculations, we all need this - **Translations** You can create your own translations to display results in your language - **Keywords** Extend the natural language support so you can type `100 dolares a pesos` and see the result of `100usd to mxn`
## How to use You can simply open Alfred and start typing, here you can see some examples of what you can do with this workflow:
#### Currency conversion
- 100 us dollars in mexican pesos - 100 usd mxn - 100 euros to dollars - 100 euros in dollars - 100 euros as dollars - 100 canadian dollars in argentinian peso - 100usd yen - 100€ to $ - 100 ¥ in € - 100¥ € - 100eur (if no target the currency will be converted to the base currencies that you configured)
#### Cryptocurrency conversion
- 2 bitcoins to dollars - 0.1 bitcoin in dollars - 5 bitcoins in ethereum - 1 ethereum to ¥ - 10 ethereum in mxn - 1eth btc - 1btc (if no target currency is provided, the configured base currency will be used)
#### Unit conversion
- 100 kilometers to meters - 100 km in meters - 100 km m - 100km m
- 100 miles as meters - 100miles in meters - 100 miles to m
- 100 ounces to kilograms - 100oz to kg - 100oz = kg - 100oz kg
- 10 years to months - 10years to seconds - 10 years hr - 1 year to sec - 1hr secods - 1hr s - 10 days hr - 10 días a horas (use your own language)
#### Data storage conversion
- 100 gigabytes in megabytes - 100 gigas in megas - 100 Mebibytes in Kibibytes - 100 gb to mb - 100gb to kb - 100gb mb - 400MiB in kib - 2tb gb - 1b kb
#### Percentages conversion
- 40 as a % of 50 - 20 is what % of 50 - 15% of 50 - 120 + 30% - 120 plus 30% - 120 - 30% - 120 minus 30% - 30 % 40
Translations and natural language can also be used
- 120 más 30% - 120 menos 10% - 40 como % de 50
#### PX, EM, REM, PT conersion
- 12px - 12px to em - 2 rem - 2rem - 2rem to pt - 12px in em base 17px
#### Time
Given its less frequently used, time conversions require the use of the keyword `time`.
converts the timestamp to a regular date - time 1577836800
gives you the time from now plus 15 days - time +15 days - time now plus 3 days
gives you the time from now plus 3 working days - time today + 3 workdays - time now + 3 workdays - time + 3 workdays
number of days until specified date - time days until 31 december
You can find more examples in the documentation, link at the bottom.
#### Vat
Given its less frequently used, time conversions require the use of the keyword `vat`.
- vat of 400 (with a 16% VAT configured, a percentage you can configure)
## Documentation
You can find the documentation on Github https://github.com/biati-digital/alfred-calculate-anything
## Support
If you need help please do not hesitate to open an issue filling all the questions in the bug report template https://github.com/biati-digital/alfred-calculate-anything
**Made with love by https://www.biati.digital**
Prefered language to use in the workflow
Choose how you want to format the numbers
Select your time zone to calculate dates in your time
Number of decimals to display in currency conversions, you can enter -1 to display different number of decimals depending on your query
If you type "100 Yen" it will automatically be converted to the currencies defined here separated by comma, for example: USD, EUR
Required for currency conversion. A free API key, covering up to 1.000 requests per month, can be acquired at https://openexchangerates.org/signup/free.
The amount of hours to cache the currencies before checking for new rates, for example, enter "6" to update currencies every 6 hours
If you need crypto currencies conversion please enter your API key here. You need to get a free API key from https://coinmarketcap.com/api/pricing. This takes less than a minute.
The amount of hours to cache the crytocurrencies before checking for new rates, for example, enter "6" to update currencies every 6 hours
Number of decimals to display for crypto currencies, you can enter -1 to display every single decimal from the conversion
Configure your default VAT percentage for example 16%
Add date format so date is formatted the way you need for example: j F, Y, g:i:s You can add multiple formats separating them with a pipe for example: j F, Y, g:i:s | Y F j
Enable to always use Binary mode so 1 MB = 1024 KB if disabled then the IEC Standard is used where 1 MB = 1000 KB
